author: Staff Reporter
text:
With a sense of jubilation, students of St. Mary’s College, Thoothukudi, celebrated the annual fine arts festival, ‘Marian Art Fest 2015 -16,’ on Friday.

S. Vijaya Kumar, Senior Announcer, All India Radio, Thoothukudi, who was the chief guest, inaugurated the programme and spoke on the importance of developing artistic skills in a bid to flourish into all-round personalities.

G.M. Batcha, cine actor and karate master, who is working in the Department of Fire and Rescue Services, V.O. Chidambaranar Port Trust, Thoothukudi, appealed to the students to utilise their creative talents to the core at every possible opportunity.

Rev. Fr. Julians, correspondent, St. Thomas Matriculation Higher Secondary School, encouraged the students to emerge as creators. Sr. Alphonse Rosaline Mary, Principal, asked the students to participate in all competitions. Twenty eight competitions in various forms of art were held, she said.

Rev. Sr. Mary Joyce Baby, Assistant Professor, Department of English, welcomed the gathering.

Students asked to utilise their creative talents at every possible opportunity
title: ‘Marian Art Fest’ held
